fact_list.fact_text: Do not make a U-turn at any road intersection, junction, or opening in a road divider except where a U-turn sign is located.
Always negotiate a U-turn carefully, especially if roadside trees or hedges obstruct your view of oncoming traffic.
While turning, be alert for any vehicles, especially motorcycles, which may be turning together with you on your right.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait at a bend, the brow of a hill, or a bridge.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait on a footway or cycle track.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait near traffic lights or pedestrian crossings.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait on a main road or a road carrying fast-moving traffic.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait opposite or nearly opposite another stationary vehicle across the road or other obstructions.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait abreast of another vehicle.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait where it obstructs any entrance.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait facing oncoming traffic.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait along any slip road.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait on a flyover, underpass, or ramp leading to a flyover or underpass.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait on a grass verge or on a road shoulder.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait in any bus lane.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait in any designated taxi stop, except taxis.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait in any taxi stand, except taxis.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait in any bus terminus, except omnibuses.
Do not park or let your vehicle wait within “No Waiting” or “No Stopping” zones.
Parking means bringing the vehicle to a stationary position and causing it to wait other than for the immediate picking up or letting down of passengers.
Before opening a door of a vehicle, make sure that it will not endanger or inconvenience anybody on the road or footpath.
Get out on the side nearest to the kerb whenever it is possible.
When you have to stop, pull in as close as possible to the edge of the road.
Whenever you park, turn off the engine and engage the handbrake.
Whenever you park, put your car into reverse gear if facing downhill and into low gear if facing uphill.
Whenever you park, remove the ignition key.
Whenever you park, lock the steering mechanism or activate the burglar alarm if your car is fitted with one.
Whenever you park, wind up the windows and lock the doors.
Whenever you park, keep your valuables in the boot or in a place where they cannot be seen.
You are not allowed to leave any broken-down or wrecked vehicle on any public road.
If your vehicle breaks down on the road, push it into a breakdown bay or as close to the side of the road as possible.
If your vehicle breaks down, switch on the hazard warning lights even during daylight and place a reflective warning triangle at least 20 metres behind the vehicle.
If your vehicle breaks down, arrange for it to be towed away immediately so as not to cause obstruction to the flow of traffic.
